author: Times staff
title: Morton to defend state championship starting Friday
text: Morton to defend state championship starting Friday Comment By Times Staff Posted Oct. 13, 2015 @ 12:06 am Defending champion Morton will get the chance to defend its IHSA Class 2A state championship on Friday in Normal at Illinois State University’s Weibring Golf Club. Morton won a sectional title Monday by shooting a 301 on the day at Lincoln Elks Club in Lincoln. Normal (University) (314) and Dunlap (317) rounded out the top three advancing schools. Reigning state champion Tommy Kuhl finished the day third overall shooting a 1-under par 70. The overall medalist from the event was Bailey Gill of Springfield High School, who shot a 68. David Perkins of East Peoria shot a 69 to finish in second place. Also scoring for Morton were Pete Kuhl (71), Issac Ingold (77). Bobby Strode and Adam Christianson tied with an 83. Dunlap’s scoring golfers on Monday were Ethan Uken (76), Gabe Sowards (78), Evan Fairfield (81), Trevor Hickey (82). Though Perkins advanced to the state tournament, his team finished sixth with a 323. Perkins’ big day comes on the heels of an impressive regional performance where he was the medalist Oct. 6 at Metamora Fields Golf Club. Pekin duo advances Despite missing the sectional meet at the Spencer T. Olin golf course in Alton as a team by one stroke at regional play, the Dragons are sending two golfers to the state championship on Friday. Mason Ghidina and Lance Hays will both travel to Normal for the event. The duo both shot a 79 on Monday, good for a place in the top 10 for advancing individuals. Tremont falls short The Tremont Turks fell shot of an appearance at the state championship on Friday. The Turks traveled to the Deer Run Golf Course in Hamilton on Tuesday. Tremont shot 396 as a team, placing 11th in the sectional. There were no individual advancers. Lady Dragons stumble The Pekin Lady Dragons fell short as a team at the Normal Community sectional on Monday. Pekin placed in 12th at the sectional shooting 412 on the day. Taylor DeGolyer (92) led the way for the Lady Dragons followed by Keely Cooper (99), Hannah Patterson (109) and Sarah McKenzie (112). None of the Dragons advanced individually. Allison Kinsinger of Washington advanced to the state chmapionship by carding 81 on the day, placing her second overall for the tournament. She will be joined at the state tournament by Amanda Greenan of Limestone. Morton’s season ends The Morton Lady Potters’ season ended on Monday during their sectional match at Peru. As a team Morton shot 387, good for sixth place in the tournament. Morton also did not have an individual advance to the state championship.
